intro: Jacquemontia uleana, commonly known as the yellow false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet, sunny habitats such as marshes and roadside ditches. The plant features showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, arranged in clusters along the stem. Its leaves are opposite, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. The species is part of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar climbing or trailing growth habits.
